name: Hotel Crowne Plaza Berlin City Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at Crown Plaza on holiday for 3 days at the end of August,. The location is excellent: close to the Ka De We and to many shops. The hotel was clean and well managed. The room needs to be refurbished. However the bed was comfortable with pillows to choose from. Breakfast and dinner were included in our package- breakfast was what you might expect in a buffet but the dinner menu in the package was rather restricted. No free WiFi and there were long waiting times to use the computers in the lobby. For us the dinner/breakfast package was a good choice and we were satisfied with our stay.
reviews.title: Good Location Clean Comfortable Hotel

reviews.text: Just back from a few days in Berlin and stayed at the Crowne Plaza which was in a great location, but the hotel itself really needs to be redecorated. Rooms were not what we expected, and disappointed in the overall cleanliness. Quite obvious that the tiles are not being cleaned. There were hairs in the sink when we got there, basic toiletries provided. There were bathrobes, but the actual bath towels were more like hand towels. Would have loved a big fluffy towel when stepping out of the shower.
reviews.title: Good location, poor hotel though

reviews.text: We had a huge bed and 2 single duvets, but seemed that they just threw the covers up when they were making the bed each day, definitely not a lot of care taken. Tea/coffee facilities were on offer, but the kettle had to be moved over to the desk, where the plug was. There was a safe provided and the black out curtains were good too.
reviews.title: GREAT

reviews.text: The staff were very friendly. We didn't eat there, preferring to have cheaper breakfasts etc outside. Oh, and at 12.50 EUR per day for internet access, again it's cheaper to use a cafe down the street. (still can't figure this out, maybe someone can tell how a hotel can justify this price????)
reviews.title: friendly and comfortable

reviews.text: Last day we checked out and decided to have lunch in the hotel restaurant, Wilson's Prime Rin restaurant. There were many dishes on offer, but we chose to go with the burger (17.50 EUR for regular, and 22.50 EUR for large). Burgers came out with a generous helping of potato wedges, and salad. But when we bit into them, they were the most disgusting thing we ever ate. They were completely riddled with salt, it was as if the chef emptied a complete container in. When we pointed out the issue to the staff, they offered another meal, but at this point, we were both not in the mood. They said it was their fault, and did not accept payment for the 2 glasses of wine we had. Pity that this was the end to the trip, but kinda summed up the hotel. They need to step up to the mark, it is nowhere near the standard of Crowne Plaza hotels, I have stayed in or eaten in.
reviews.title: Right Location, Room need a refurbishing

reviews.text: The location of the Hotel is very good. It is in the center of West Berlin near the Kurfurstendumm shopping area, the zoo and the Ka-De-We shopping store. It is about 20 minutes taxi drive from Tegel airport with a taxi cost of 15-20 euros. I find this hotel a great value for under 100 euros and it offers exactly what should one expect from a four star hotel. The room is very clean it has everything you need, confortable bed and pillows and very quiet. The restaurant is very good if you like stake and the breakfast is quite complete. There is also a nice bar if you wish to try some German beer.
reviews.title: Value for the money

reviews.text: The negatives: You have to buy a card in order to use the computer and you have to pay in order to use the Sauna. But I have to admit that the did not charge me for either since I used them for a very short time.
reviews.title: 'Excellent' in terms of location. 'Poor' in terms of everything else.

reviews.text: I was staying with a group of other people in Crowne Plaza Hotel about two weeks ago. The location of the hotel is amazing - it is 2 minutes away from the Berlin Zoo,which is worth visiting, 5 minutes away from the great shopping center Ka De We and the underground station (Wittenbergplatz U-Bahn).
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: The hotel itself was a disappointment to me for a few reasons.
reviews.title: Everything except the pool was perfect

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very nice and I found everything that I would include in my breakfast. However, during our stay one of the women of our group had her purse stolen from the restaurant during breakfast. This made her stay quite unpleasant since she is not German and she had to spend two days in the embassy to retrieve a temporary document that would replace her passport. The trouble she went through did not seem to be of any interest to the staff because all they did was to say they are sorry immediately after the unfortunate event and that was it. They did not even bother to ask her if she needed anything,they just left her on her own.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Great location and friendly, helpful staff. Located near U-bahn subway for convenient access to all of Berlin. Ku'damm shopping, zoo, Kasier Wilhelm Memorial Church and numerous restaurants are all within a half-block.
reviews.title: Great Location
Average 4 star hotel
reviews.text: Downside was very expensive breakfast and air-conditioning that cannot keep up with 80+ degree weather.
Would recommmend and would stay there again.
reviews.title: A fantastic choice!
Excellent
reviews.text: This is an ordinary 4 star chain hotel with a small swimming pool, expensive services and small rooms, which look all the same. The elevator system is quite complicated, but if you need a good and central hotel for two nights, which is not too expensive for what you get, this is the right hotel for you.
Stayed there mid April for three nights at an excellent rate off Crowne Plaza's own web site.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: This was my second trip to this hotel. It is what you would expect. Nice spacious room. The bathroom was a bit worn and a taller person may have felt claustraphoic in the shower as the ceiling was low.
reviews.title: Typical business hotel

reviews.text: My main complaint is no free wi-fi. I say this every time I am in a hotel where I would expect this and hotels should wake up to this. I don't have to pay for TV so why should I pay for wi-fi? It is a basic service and given a choice between the two I would choose wi-fi
reviews.title: Good location but I do not want to pay €12.50 for wifi!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The English speaking TV channels were all news channels (Sky,BBC, Bloomberg etc) - what about some other channels - eg BBC1 or a movie channel.
reviews.title: Good hotel,good location.

reviews.text: It was soooo cold in Berlin (well colder than I expected and prepared for) that I ate down in the lobby restaurant, I had a club sandwich which was described as coming with a side salad and crisps. There was no salad so I mentioned this and I was told the salad was in the sandwich..... Hmmm think not! Won't be having that again.
reviews.title: Good location but very poor service

reviews.text: I am back in Berlin this week and trying a different hotel so see if that is any better
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: great hotel 3 min from Ka De We and very close to train station , the buffet is a real great value!
reviews.title: the best

reviews.text: It is a wonderful hotel at a great location. The gym is good and free. The swimmingpool very small, but still nice. For the tiny sauna they charge 7.50. Sad and not worth it. I was let in for free, 10 minutes before closing time, by a friendly employee. But i wouldnt have paid 7.50 for it. There seemed to be a list with VIPs that didnt have to pay. I was not on it (being Platinum didnt help).
reviews.title: Beautiful, modern hotel. Too bad they charge for the sauna.

reviews.text: Wifi internet access however was free in my room thanks to my status. There were also chocolates and a free bottle of water in my room. Bed was very confortable - i received an upgrade and a newspaper in the morning. Also they brought me stuff to my room (toothbrush) really quickly. Good service, nice place. No club lounge available though.
reviews.title: Generally fine

reviews.text: The room is quite nice and comfortable, especially the bed, and it was clean and well-kept. The breakfast is good, with plenty of options. And the location is pretty good, close to the Ka De We shopping center. My biggest issue was the service. One evening, I needed some water and had to spend 8 EUR from the restaurant because nothing was open and there was no regular gift shop in the hotel. Ridiculous! For water. And, one morning, I asked about nearby coffee, like Caros (a local coffee shop I knew of) or Starbucks. I was told there was a Starbucks about 4 blocks away. However, when I found it, it was closed and didn't open in the morning, only the afternoon. I would expect a hotel to know this type of information, especially since one block further was a Caros, which I found on my own and which was open. Maybe I am asking too much ...? I was there for a conference and several items in the conference room also didn't work, which was inconvenient. Overall, a fine place, but the service was just not that good.
reviews.title: Absolutely fine

reviews.text: I stayed here on a work trip a few weeks ago. It's a perfectly adequate hotel within walking distance of shopping areas and underground. The room was clean and the staff was professional.
reviews.title: Worth staying here for the breakfast alone!

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in order to visit the Christmas markets in Berlin. The first thing that strikes you as you enter the hotel is the cigarette smoke from guests sitting in the foyer. This at the very least should be a non-smoking area. The staff were sometimes helpful and sometimes not. The room was average with a comfortable bed and a clean bathroom. TV channels were limited and air-conditioning noisey. Floors are accessed via five large fast lifts. Breakfast was very good with a vast choice of food but too bad if you need an extra knife or spoon because the cutlery is well hidden and don't expect your breakfast to still be there when you get back if you go searching for anything. Unfortunately for us the night we chose to stay for dinner the hotel was staging a very limited "Italian" themed night. The lack of people eating there should have warned us. The regular hotel patrons obviously knew better. The hotel bars are seriously in need of modernisation. The seating in the "Pinte" bar is worse than the local underground trains and extremely uncomfortable. The piano bar is not much better with leather stools from the 1960's. Both bars are extortionate and again very smokey. The lobby area is inhabited by a few worn-out chairs so, as a place of relaxation, not very inviting. Best to go out in the evenings. The hotel is well situated for the nearby markets, shopping and main-line station Zoologicher Garten. Although we enjoyed our weekend the reason we booked the Crowne Plaza was because we had stayed in the Crowne Plaza in Cologne last year. This hotel needs a lot of money spending on it to bring it up to the same standard and it needs to sort out it's abysmal smoking policy.
reviews.title: Reasonable but not brilliant
Great hotel, super location
reviews.text: Just returned from the Crowne Plaza. What a lovely hotel. Staff friendly, breakfast great choice, rooms lovely and clean, especially liked the chocs on pillow, nice touch!

Excellent location, for the Ka De We department store and the Kurfurstendamn. Also Europa Centre just around the corner, with a great Irish Bar. Christmas markets are really something, great atmosphere and all the Christmas decorations and trees are wonderful. A great place for a long weekend. We will return to the Crowne Plaza next year around the same time.
reviews.title: Getting a bit long in the tooth?

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel for three nights in October, and was slightly disappointed overall. I'm not sure how long it has been since the last renovation, but my room seemed to have experienced quite a few years without any new furniture/carpeting etc. The door to the hallway had quite a gap under it, which also added to a less than satisfactory appearance. The bathroom was ok at least, and the bed was also comfortable. As usual (unfortunately) the TV had just CNN and BBC World for english-speakers, it would have been nice in a 4-star hotel to have a few more channels.
reviews.title: good location in berlin

reviews.text: On the positive side, all the staffmembers I met were friendly and helpful. The location is also great, five minutes walk from Bahnhof Zoo, two minutes from KaDeWe.
reviews.title: Great Location!!
Good value central hotel
reviews.text: Just returned from two nights stay at this hotel. As usual looked at Trip Advisor first and previous reviews are a bit varied, which always intrigues me. Bluntly, it is formulaic and not full of character. but for what you get it is very good value. I booked direct on the net and got a decent price (av Euro 110 per night including tax, but then add Euro 17.50 for breakfast) for a 4 star central Berlin hotel, and what they term an "Executive" room (so a mini bar, coffee/tea maker, trouser press, iron and ironing board, decent desk and arm chair and dressing gowns plus lots of toiletries - but no in room safe deposit box).

Room was spotless and comfortable. Away from the road, 5th floor, and very peaceful - in fact I could not believe I was in the centre of Berlin just a few hundred metres from Zoo station and the Zoo itself (although there was a very minor noise issue - see below!). It was good for work, and the location would make it good for a pleasure trip too.
reviews.title: Efficient but a little bit austere
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: Quibbles (but not really negatives) - a/c not that efficient on a warm spring day so I opened the window and although there was no traffic or people noise, and no noise from adjacent rooms, there was a very noisy family of sparrows that woke me up at 5 in the morning (quite a nice problem compared with many hotels though) Reception staff are a bit impersonal but did speak a variety of languages well - and a couple of staff were really helpful. I had to use the business centre - Euros 5.50 for 15 mins, plus a Euro a page to send a fax (remember that old technology? But when your laptop has problems there still is no other option) Breakfast staff a bit variable too - initially slow to offer coffee - but slightly overzealous when they cleared my paper and food one morning when I went to get some more toast - but were equally rapid and extremely apologetic in retrieving my paper and providing fresh coffee when I arrived back at my table and they immediately realised what had happened.

Positives - comfy room, clean and well appointed. Delicious and extensive breakfast buffet (not as good as Bayerischer Hof in Munich or Hilton in Korea, but better than most others at this price point) - very fresh produce and lots of choice - from the very healthy to the very calorie/carb laden. The exec rooms include a turn down service, free mineral water, night time chocs and a sachet of sweets. Plenty of hot water, (but slightly noisy plumbing for the over bath shower). BEST of all, as another reviewer has noted, that wonderful facility where the sound from the telly is piped into the bathroom - I love hotels with that.
reviews.title: Austere Atmosphere

aka: Hotel Crowne Plaza Berlin City Berlin
description: The Hotel Crowne Plaza Berlin City Centre is located in the center of Berlin only a few steps away from the famous boulevard Kurfuerstendamm, the well-known department store KaDeWe, the Kaiser-Wilhelm-Memorial Church and the Zoological Garden. The Crowne Plaza Berlin City Centre with 423 comfortably appointed rooms including 11 suites, provide all the comforts of a 4-star plus hotel (Extra beds on request = EUR 31,-- per night). Non smoking floors and accessible rooms as well as a 24-hour room service and a business center are also available.The wellness area in the Crowne Plaza Berlin City Centre with indoor pool, sauna, solarium, extensive offers of massage and a fitness section with a wide variety of endurance and and weight-lifting machines are suited to accomodate guests needing to relax. The Wilson's restaurant with its international cuisine pampers the discerning gourmet with culinary delights. In the beer pub Pinte savoury regional dishes are served. The Kemmons Bar offers a variety of cocktails and snacks. 14 meeting rooms including the conference center with natural lighting and an integrated ceiling height of 4,50m can accommodate functions up to 1.000 delegates. W-LAN/High Speed Internet Access are available in all areas of the Crowne Plaza Berlin City Centre.
